title: I actually like the smite nerf
body:
Well, at least I like the concept behind it.

But I've got an idea about how to implement it a bit more efficiently.

Lee Sin: Q range and projectile speed reduced.
Jarvan IV: EQ combo pull-through speed reduced.

Smite: Unchanged.

There. Problem solved, without backhanding every other jungler in the face.

replies.body: Or just stop nerfing the jungle because it's already frustrating to play

They can't do that.
Currently, Junglers have too much power. So they have to gate them better.

Of course. By "junglers", I mean the 2 or 3 LCS junglers.
And by "Gate", I mean make sure no one *else* is capable of having that much influence.
Is it weird that I really like the new jungle? A lot.

I like it, too. It's a little harder, but you don't have to necessarily follow the same exact clear path every time, and it feels more rewarding to play a good jungle game than it did before. I honestly don't understand how people die to the jungle monsters constantly

I actually sorta just assumed they were parroting what they heard elsewhere online. I've only died once really to the new jungle, though I'll admit there were times I was VERY vulnerable to an invade. The thing is....so was the other guy. We were both beaten senseless by our jungles, so everything ended up ok.

The jungle is dangerous again. I love it.

What I don't like about the new jungle is the lack of XP 
if I'm power farming and doing nothing else, I should at least be even in levels with a laner.

I'd need to crunch the numbers to know for sure, but I'm pretty sure you can level faster than bottom lane and only a little slower than mid or top.
Considering the Jungler has far more strategic options than mid or top, I would argue that its fair they level a little slower than a solo lane when powerfarming. Mid laners stay mid, top stays top, Jungle can appear bot, or top, or mid, or the enemy jungle, or the river, or he can keep farming his own space. It makes sense that given these choices they pay the cost of not having *quite* the income of a solo farm lane. Otherwise the ganks would just be gravy, and junglers would be even stronger than they are now.

I kind of like it too, but I think the monsters and lack of healing potions are just a little bit too hard.

I was playing a game recently where I was Shaco.  The enemy top-laner came into my jungle and pestered me so much that I had to waste my potions couldn't get level 2 from my first camp since she stole one of the monsters; I was then completely unable to clear a second and had to recall.

The current jungle is balanced on a knife-edge.  You have to do things perfectly to manage a full clear on most junglers (if they can even manage it at all), and it leaves you really close to death.  If anything interferes with your first clear, you are put really far behind, and with the now more-expensive upgraded jungle item, being behind is really harsh.

That's the thing - they increased the cost to stop junglers from snowballing (???) if they got first blood, but instead it makes it much, much harder for a jungler who gets invaded early to recover.

Basically put: I like the concept of the new jungle, but I feel it's too unforgiving.
The fact that they outright refuse to dethrone {{champion:64}} only makes it worse.

I agree. I wish they would just re-make Lee Sin already.

I understand why they don't. Taric, Poppy, Hell even Shen, or perhaps Shaco could use the resources more, but Lee will never stop being top tier unless they remake him.

We also never will get a better martial artist as long as lee sin exists. Hes are kung fu champ. We deserve a better one.
I'd argue that a champion who is in nearly every game needs a rework more than one that's hardly ever played (even if they reason they are hardly ever played is because they need a rework.)

The only thing I do not like is Jarvin and Lee Sin.

Vi has always been ridiculous, just outclassed by Lee Sin.

If all 3 were to be nerfed, we would be golden, as long as they dont get gutted.

Are they overpowered? Yes. Should they be olaf'd? No
If J4 was nerfed, someone else would just take his place. He was literally nothing special before this season.

Ridiculous damage, mobility, tankyness and utility? There are far fewer junglers like that than you might think. He's like Cait, just because he isn't always as abused as the newest OP pick doesn't mean he isn't permafotm.

Then why did no one complain about him before this season? And Cait isn't really 'permafotm'. She's just a 'staple'. She's easy to use, and givs decent results. She's pretty much a back up adc for everyone.
Because there are more broken picks to complain about. Kind of why people are only now complaining about Lee Sin.
I've been a part of this community for a long time. There are always people who are down to complain about Lee Sin. Always.
I'm pretty sure there's a difference between "some people" and a whole community finally getting sick of his broken design.
It also doesn't mean he is a problem. Someone is gonna be top tier, and Jarvan is a healthier top tier champ than say....poppy. Or urgot. Or Warwick for that matter.

Someone will always be the strongest jungler. Who is it gonna be if you nerf those 3? 

Its like the Renekton Bar problem. Lee Sin is the best champ when played well, but lots of players can't do that.

Conversely, when Warwick was the best jungler in the game (for 12 minutes) there was just nothing anybody could do. (I love warwick though.)

Or, get this, there are more than three champions that can be viable at the time? There's a difference between some champions being slightly stronger than others and some champions completely dominating due to their kits.

how is the new jungle even hard? You clear gromp/blue/scut then back then you have infinite sustain with an op smite
because some junglers with the right path can actually clear the entire jungle before backing. if both junglers decide to do a full clear - back - gank, who will gank first?

I feel like most junglers are actually capable of full clears. It's just the knowledge needed to do it. Gotta have the right masteries, runes, etc. Not to mention squishier junglers should start krugs (golems), and higher sustain junglers should start gromp (frog). And one trick that gets missed is on the raptors (birds) kill the SMALL ones first! They do a ton of damage and it's much easier to finish them off with a higher amount of health if you kill the little guys first.
how you "feel" doesn't really matter. the fact is a lot of junglers can't do a full clear without backing.

so what? it only takes 4 camps to afford the upgrade and you got a leash on the first one.

EDIT: I haven't played all the junglers, but I do play Evelyn. She can clear Gromp, then blue, then wolves, then red. It is tight, and I need to use my early vision to guard red, but I can clear those 4, recall, buy upgrade then go gank.

This is an acceptable situation in my opinion. Not every jungler should be able to do camp after camp early game. Let guys like Warwick or Amumu do that. Let it be a niche for a few instead of just something all junglers get.

Most early game junglers NEED chilling smite to be viable.
Evelyn, Nautilus, Hecarim, Warwick, they don't have much CC until level 6, and this enables them to be on a more even playing field with other junglers.

Nautilus, Eve, and Hecarim were all strong at some point long before you could smite champions, so no, they don't *need* it to gank. The problem mostly lies in having low HP all the time - Eve and Hecarim lose quite a bit of health clearing, while Naut's clear takes ages, resulting in him losing a lot of HP unless he gets a super strong leash. Naut's ganks are still strong as fuck - you can't go wrong with 4 CCs in one kit - but he just doesn't have the HP to gank very often.

I also find it rather amusing that you claim Naut doesn't have much pre-6 CC when he has more than 90% of other champions in the game. The dude brings a root, a hook, and a slow pre 6, 2 slows if you rush chilling smite for some reason.

Notably, all the junglers that are strong now (with the exception of Rek'Sai, who was not a champion at the time) were also strong at some point before chilling smite was introduced - it's just icing on the cake. Chilling smite mostly makes it so that when you actually do have the HP to gank as a jungler it's more likely to net you a kill or assist. Basically, in the current season compared to previous seasons, most junglers have traded frequency of ganks for more reliable ganks due to chilling smite. Because most junglers will fall horribly behind if their ganks fail, chilling smite is pretty much always gonna be the best choice because it makes for the least likely to fail ganks.

I'd even go so far as to wager that if chilling smite did no damage it would still be the best choice on 90% of junglers because it gives you the most reliable ganks.

5 star post amigo. You make a great point about the new smites.
